comment: CATY_13 Residual Income Valuation - Clean Surplus Accounting
data_source: COE triangulation + Financial forecasts + Clean surplus framework

valuation_summary.methodology: Residual Income Model (RIM) with probabilistic triangulation
valuation_summary.consistency_check: Aligned with peer regression (+16.1%) and Gordon Growth (-16.5%) triangulation

narratives.executive_highlight_html:
RIM Target Price: $50.08 (+6.3% vs. $47.13 spot)

RIM valuation yields HOLD rating (4.2% upside < 15% BUY threshold), consistent with peer regression (+16.1%) and Gordon Growth (-16.5%) triangulation.
narratives.key_insight_html: Key Insight: RIM isolates value creation (ROTE > COE) from accounting book value, providing conservative baseline less sensitive to market multiples or growth assumptions.
narratives.rim_formula_box_html:
Intrinsic Value = Book Value + Present Value of Future Residual Income

V₀ = BV₀ + Σ [RI_t / (1 + COE)^t]

Where:

  • V₀ = Intrinsic equity value per share (today)
  • BV₀ = Book value per share (today)
  • RI_t = Residual income in year t = (ROE_t - COE) × BV_(t-1)
  • COE = Cost of equity (9.587%)
  • t = Forecast year (1 to n, then terminal value)

Key Advantage: RIM anchors to book value (observable, less manipulable than earnings) and values only excess returns (ROTE > COE).
narratives.residual_income_definition_html:
Residual Income (RI) = Economic profit after charging for equity capital

RI_t = NI_t - (COE × BV_(t-1))
Alternatively: RI_t = (ROE_t - COE) × BV_(t-1)

Interpretation:

  • If ROE > COE → Positive RI → Value creation
  • If ROE < COE → Negative RI → Value destruction
  • If ROE = COE → Fair value = Book value
narratives.book_value_reconciliation_html:
Book Value Reconciliation

Model uses $36.16 (CET1 basis) for consistency with existing valuation framework. GAAP TBVPS = $45.05.

IRC STANDARD: Use GAAP TBVPS for RIM (matches financial statements, auditable).

For this analysis: BV₀ = $36.16 (CET1 per share for consistency)
narratives.forecast_horizon_html:
• Explicit Forecast Period: 5 years (2026-2030)
  • Terminal Value: Perpetuity (year 6+)

Rationale: 5-year horizon balances visibility, cyclicality, and IRC standards
narratives.bv_growth_assumptions_html:
Clean Surplus Relation:

BV_t = BV_(t-1) + NI_t - Dividends_t

Assumptions:

  • Payout Ratio: 75% (normalized, target range 70-80%)
  • Retention Ratio: 25%
  • BV Growth: g = ROE × (1 - Payout Ratio) = ROE × 0.25
narratives.terminal_assumptions_html:
• Terminal ROTE: 10.21% (normalized through-cycle)
  • Terminal BV: $41.26 (end of Year 5)
  • Terminal RI Growth: 2.5% (perpetual, matches GDP + inflation)
narratives.rim_value_highlight_html:
RIM Formula

V₀ = BV₀ + PV(RI_explicit) + PV(TV_RI)\n = $36.16 + $1.689 + $2.35\n = $40.20

RIM Target Price (CET1 basis): $40.20 (-12.4% vs. $47.13 spot)
narratives.gaap_scaling_html:
BV_0_GAAP = $45.05
Proportional scaling of RI values:
PV_RI_explicit_GAAP = $1.689 × (45.05 / 36.16) = $2.104
PV_TV_RI_GAAP = $2.35 × (45.05 / 36.16) = $2.93

V_RIM_GAAP = $45.05 + $2.104 + $2.93 = $50.08
narratives.rim_revised_highlight_html:
Revised RIM Target (GAAP TBVPS): $50.08 (+6.3%)

This represents a more realistic valuation using accounting book value.
narratives.interpretation_points_html:
• RIM (+6.3%) sits between peer regression (+16.1%) and Gordon Growth (-16.5%)
  • Conservative estimate: RIM uses through-cycle ROTE (10.21%), while peer regression uses current (12.35%)
  • Triangulation validation: RIM confirms HOLD (within -10% to +15% band)
narratives.blended_conclusion_html: Conclusion: IRC blended valuation validates Wilson framework (within $0.35, 0.7% difference).
narratives.terminal_rote_insight_html: Key Insight: Terminal ROTE drives valuation. +100 bps terminal ROTE → +$5.64/share (+11.3%).
narratives.coe_insight_html: Key Insight: COE less sensitive than ROTE. -50 bps COE → +$1.94/share (+3.9%).
qa_html_blocks:
Why does RIM show $50.08 (+6.3%) while peer regression shows $54.71 (+16.1%)?

A: Different lenses on value: (1) RIM uses through-cycle ROTE (10.21%) → Conservative, (2) Peer regression uses current ROTE (12.35%) → Aggressive. RIM is anchored to normalized earnings power, peer regression to current market multiples. Triangulation: Blend RIM (60%) + Relative (30%) → $50.97 (+8.1%).

Why weight RIM 60% vs. Relative 30%?

A: IRC standard (CBA winning report uses 60/10/30). Rationale: (1) RIM isolates intrinsic value (book value + excess returns), less market-driven, (2) Relative valuation subject to bubble/crash (peer multiples can be mispriced), (3) DDM 10% (payout policy risk).

Why use GAAP TBVPS ($45.05) instead of CET1 ($36.16)?

A: RIM convention: Use accounting book value (matches financial statements, auditable). CET1 is regulatory capital (includes deductions for DTA, intangibles per Basel III), not economic equity. Validation: Market P/BV multiples quote vs. GAAP BV, not CET1.

Is 10.21% terminal ROTE defensible?

A: Through-cycle normalization: (1) NCO 42.8 bps (FDIC long-term avg), (2) Provision drag on ROTE vs. current 18 bps, (3) Peer median ROTE 8.77% (CATY's 10.21% still +144 bps premium). Conservative choice: Avoids extrapolating current 12.35% ROTE (peak-of-cycle).
narratives.python_code_html:
# RIM Valuation Model
import numpy as np

# Inputs
BV_0 = 45.05  # GAAP TBVPS (Oct 2025)
COE = 0.09587  # Cost of equity
g_terminal = 0.025  # Terminal growth
payout_ratio = 0.75

# ROTE forecast
rote_forecast = [0.1150, 0.1100, 0.1050, 0.1030, 0.1021]  # 2026-2030
rote_terminal = 0.1021

# Book value evolution
BV = [BV_0]
for i, rote in enumerate(rote_forecast):
    ni = rote * BV[i]
    dividends = ni * payout_ratio
    bv_next = BV[i] + ni - dividends
    BV.append(bv_next)

# Residual income (explicit period)
RI_explicit = []
for i, rote in enumerate(rote_forecast):
    ri = (rote - COE) * BV[i]
    RI_explicit.append(ri)

# Present value of explicit RI
PV_RI_explicit = sum([ri / (1 + COE)**(i+1) for i, ri in enumerate(RI_explicit)])

# Terminal value
BV_2030 = BV[-1]
BV_2031_start = BV_2030 * (1 + g_terminal)
RI_2031 = (rote_terminal - COE) * BV_2031_start
TV_RI = RI_2031 / (COE - g_terminal)
PV_TV_RI = TV_RI / (1 + COE)**5

# RIM intrinsic value
V_RIM = BV_0 + PV_RI_explicit + PV_TV_RI

print(f"RIM Intrinsic Value: ${V_RIM:.2f}")
print(f"Current Price: $47.13")
print(f"Upside/Downside: {((V_RIM / 47.13) - 1) * 100:.1f}%")

# Expected output:
# RIM Intrinsic Value: $50.08
# Current Price: $47.13
# Upside/Downside: +6.3%

code.snippet:
# RIM Valuation Model
import numpy as np

# Inputs
BV_0 = 45.05  # GAAP TBVPS (Oct 2025)
COE = 0.09587  # Cost of equity
g_terminal = 0.025  # Terminal growth
payout_ratio = 0.75

# ROTE forecast
rote_forecast = [0.1150, 0.1100, 0.1050, 0.1030, 0.1021]  # 2026-2030
rote_terminal = 0.1021

# Book value evolution
BV = [BV_0]
for i, rote in enumerate(rote_forecast):
    ni = rote * BV[i]
    dividends = ni * payout_ratio
    bv_next = BV[i] + ni - dividends
    BV.append(bv_next)

# Residual income (explicit period)
RI_explicit = []
for i, rote in enumerate(rote_forecast):
    ri = (rote - COE) * BV[i]
    RI_explicit.append(ri)

# Present value of explicit RI
PV_RI_explicit = sum([ri / (1 + COE)**(i+1) for i, ri in enumerate(RI_explicit)])

# Terminal value
BV_2030 = BV[-1]
BV_2031_start = BV_2030 * (1 + g_terminal)
RI_2031 = (rote_terminal - COE) * BV_2031_start
TV_RI = RI_2031 / (COE - g_terminal)
PV_TV_RI = TV_RI / (1 + COE)**5

# RIM intrinsic value
V_RIM = BV_0 + PV_RI_explicit + PV_TV_RI

print(f"RIM Intrinsic Value: ${V_RIM:.2f}")
print(f"Current Price: $47.13")
print(f"Upside/Downside: {((V_RIM / 47.13) - 1) * 100:.1f}%")

# Expected output:
# RIM Intrinsic Value: $50.08
# Current Price: $47.13
# Upside/Downside: +6.3%
